body:
I can't think of any reason why we should refuse to ignore a signal that can not be notified.  I think we do that because the sigignore function was copied from sigenable, which does correctly skip signals that can not be notified.

Looking at the os/signal package now, though, I'm a bit puzzled: it looks like once you call Ignore, you can call Notify, but Reset doesn't seem to restore an Ignore'd signal back to the default behavior.
